title: 114_s1379
content: The "African Free Trade Initiative Act" may be cited as the short title. The Act focuses on free trade agreements with sub-Saharan African countries. The African Growth and Opportunity Act is amended to require the President to develop a plan for free trade agreements with sub-Saharan African countries, identifying the 15 most ready countries or groups for such agreements. The plan must outline the necessary steps for each country to enter into a free trade agreement with the United States. The African Growth and Opportunity Act is amended to require the President to develop a plan for free trade agreements with sub-Saharan African countries, including the development of a bilateral investment treaty. The plan must outline milestones for each country to establish a free trade agreement with the United States within 10 years. It should also include a description of the resources needed to assist each country in achieving these milestones. The African Growth and Opportunity Act is amended to require the President to develop a plan for free trade agreements with sub-Saharan African countries. Resources may be utilized through regional organizations in sub-Saharan Africa for consultation with Congress and private sector during negotiations, implementation matters, and approval of agreements. The African Growth and Opportunity Act is amended to require the President to develop a plan for free trade agreements with sub-Saharan African countries, including consultations with relevant African governments and organizations. The President must report to Congress within 12 months of the enactment of the African Free Trade Initiative Act. Additionally, the United States Trade Representative and Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development will coordinate with the Chief Executive Officer of the Millennium Challenge Corporation on countries entering into Millennium Challenge Compacts. The Millennium Challenge Corporation oversees countries eligible for Millennium Challenge Compacts under the African Growth and Opportunity Act. SEC. 3. COORDINATION OF USAID WITH FREE TRADE AGREEMENT POLICY. Authorization of Funds for USAID under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 may be used to assist eligible countries in developing institutional capacities for free trade agreements in consultation with the United States Trade Representative. The term "eligible country" refers to a sub-Saharan African country receiving benefits under the African Growth and Opportunity Act and funding from the United States Agency for International Development. A "sub-Saharan African country" is defined in section 107 of the African Growth and Opportunity Act.
